t: Lamentations 5
A Prayer for Restoration
Remember,*pn O Lord,*s what has come upon us; Look,*ld and behold our reproach!
Our*ld inheritance has been turned over to aliens, And*ld our houses to foreigners.
We*ld have become orphans and waifs, Our*ld mothers are*i like widows.
We*ln pay for the water we drink, And*ld our wood comes at a price.
They*ild pursue at our heels; We*ld labor and*i have no rest.
We*ld have given our hand to*i the Egyptians And*ild the Assyrians, to be satisfied with bread.
Our*ln fathers sinned and*i are*i no more, But*ld we bear their iniquities.
Servants*ld rule over us; There*ild is*i none to deliver us*i from their hand.
We*ld get our bread at*i the*i risk*i of our lives, Because*ld of the sword in the wilderness.
Our*ln skin is hot as an oven, Because*ld of the fever of famine.
They*ld ravished the women in Zion, The*ld maidens in the cities of Judah.
Princes*ld were hung up by their hands, And*ld elders were not respected.
Young*ld men ground at the millstones; Boys*ld staggered under loads*i of*i wood.
The*ld elders have ceased gathering*i at*i the gate, And*ld the young men from their music.
The*ln joy of our heart has ceased; Our*ld dance has turned into mourning.
The*ld crown has fallen from*i our head. Woe*ld to us, for we have sinned!
Because*ld of this our heart is faint; Because*ld of these things*i our eyes grow dim;
Because*ld of Mount Zion which is desolate, With*ld foxes walking about on it.
You,*ln O Lord,*s remain forever; Your*ld throne from generation to generation.
Why*ld do You forget us forever, And*ild forsake us for so long a time?
Turn*ld us back to You, O Lord,*s and we will be restored; Renew*ld our days as of old,
Unless*ld You have utterly rejected us, And*ild are very angry with us!
